priorVersion.title: CDISC SDTM Schizophrenia Findings About Test Code Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C124302

self.title: CDISC SDTM Schizophrenia Findings About Test Code Terminology

definition: Terminology relevant to the test codes that describe findings about a schizophrenia event or intervention.
name: Schizophrenia Findings About Test Code
preferredTerm: CDISC SDTM Schizophrenia Findings About Test Code Terminology

terms.definition: The agent, stimulus, activity, or event that causes stress with an acute frequency, which has the highest level of severity.
The age at which the first episode occurred.
The age at which the first hospitalization event occurred.
The age at which the first treatment for the condition occurred.
The agent, stimulus, activity, or event that causes stress with a chronic frequency, which has the highest level of severity.
An indication as to whether the subject was admitted to a healthcare clinic.
The total number of episodes that have occurred for the condition.
The total number of hospitalization events that have occurred for the condition.
A description of the series of events, including signs and symptoms, that define the course of a chronic disease over time.
An indication as to whether something has happened, such as an event or incident.
The surroundings or environment within which the subject receives therapeutic treatment for the condition.
